page.title: 14Farming in Newton and Linton
page.content: Farming is the chief industry in the area with twelve farms,one part of the Huntley and Palmer estate and one owned by University College,Oxford. A common pattern of farming exists. The land is mainly arable,the crops being barley,wheat,oil seed rape, potatoes,peas and sugar beet. Grass land produces crops of silage and hay. Calves are bought in and fed,mainly on an intensive system,to produce beef. One farmer prefers to fatten Continental breeds,as these produce leaner meat.Several farmers buy in ewes from Scotland and sell out part of their flock with lambs,retaining some.Ewes lamb indoors in February and March. The farms are run as family businesses with a small amount of employed labour.One farmer,an agricultural contractor employs 5 men.
